TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SelectedDatesCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public NotInheritable Class SelectedDatesCollection Implements ICollection
public ref class SelectedDatesCollection sealed : System::Collections::ICollection
type SelectedDatesCollection = class interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Encapsulates a collection of objects that represent the selected dates in a control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this class to programmatically manage a collection of <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=nameWithType> objects that represent the selected dates in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control. This class is commonly used to add or remove dates from the collection.
This collection stores only whole dates. The time portion of each <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=nameWithType> is removed. The dates are stored in ascending order. If there are duplicate dates, only one date is stored in the collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> class to select dates in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic SelectedDatesCollection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic SelectedDatesCollection Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic SelectedDatesCollection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic SelectedDatesCollection Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to determine the number of dates in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection.Count%2A> property is often used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of dates in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection. Note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed
abstract member GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator override this.GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator

Docs.summary: Returns an -implemented object that contains all objects within the collection.
Docs.returns: An -implemented object that contains all objects within the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType>-implemented object that can be easily iterated through to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move the enumerator back to the initial position.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method needs to be called after creating an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType>-implemented object or using the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is undefined.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCellCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType>-implemented object that is iterated through to display the selected dates from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic SelectedDatesCollection.GetEnumerator Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic SelectedDatesCollection.GetEnumerator Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic SelectedDatesCollection.GetEnumerator Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic SelectedDatesCollection.GetEnumerator Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection> collection can be written to in all cases.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean
public: property bool IsSynchronized { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is derived from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> and is overridden to always return `false`.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SelectedDatesCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface.
